channel.title: How to send out a login message?
channel.description: I want to make it say something whenever I, or other staff members log in. Anyone have a code?

item.title: How to send out a login message?
item.dc:creator: @frostscapeserver frostscapeserver
item.description:
@frostscapeserver wrote:

:S Not working. hmm might it be-
if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Tyler”)) {
yell(“Owner Tyler has logged in!”);

I’ll try it :0

Found it

if (server.playerHandler.isPlayerOn(playerName)) {
yell(“Owner Tyler has logged in!”);

^^^Nvrm…not working
if(server.playerHandler.isPlayerOn(“Tyler”)) {
modyell(“Owner Tyler has logged in!”)

This wont work either
if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Tyler”) && !connectedFrom.equals(“192.168.1.101”)) {
modyell(“Owner Tyler has logged in!”)

Read full topic
item.source: How to send out a login message?

item.title: How to send out a login message?
item.dc:creator: @abcpker711 abcpker711
item.description:
@abcpker711 wrote:

if (playerRights=2) {
yell("Administrator “+ p.playername + " has logged in!”);
should do the trick, and it should be pasted right under “Yell” NOT DIRECTLY UNDER… but under all of the ::Yell quotes/ messages etc…

Read full topic

item.title: How to send out a login message?

item.description:
@frostscapeserver wrote:

Yeah mines +p.playerName+ Thanks alot o.O Can I just declare it at the bottom of client.java? :S I’m not good with declaring codes

But sM only sends a message to you, no the whole server :S

item.title: How to send out a login message?
item.dc:creator: @abcpker711 abcpker711
item.description:
@abcpker711 wrote:

No offence, Chaos… but it’s not “Yell” method. It’s a sM method, so it’d go something like…
if (playerSkill=90) {
sM(" +playerName+ " has reached 90 Strength."); or some crap. =o

item.title: How to send out a login message?
item.dc:creator: @abcpker711 abcpker711
item.description:
@abcpker711 wrote:

Then it should probly be something like,

if(playerRights=2){
sM(“Administrator +p.Name+ has logged in.”);
if(playerRights=1){
sM(“Moderator +pName+ has logged in.”);
how ever, I’m not sure if +p.Name+ is a correct method, so you might want to look at the yell log, and see what they use as a +name+": type thing, you know?

item.title: How to send out a login message?
item.dc:creator: @abcpker711 abcpker711
item.description:
@abcpker711 wrote:

Depends on the server deobe… for 562 it’s in the “Data/Scripts/Authentication” file. For 317’s it’s usually in the “Client” file… and for 508’s it’s somewhere in SRC.

Read full topic
